newsitem.title: USA: Sterling Software to buy Texas Instruments unit.
newsitem.headline: Sterling Software to buy Texas Instruments unit.

text.p: Sterling Software Inc. has a definitive agreement to buy the Texas Instruments Software division of Texas Instruments Inc. for $165 million cash, the companies said Monday
The deal includes all Texas Instruments Software assets, including the stock of certain European subsidiaries, and various liabilities related to the business.

Texas Instruments Software, based in Plano, Texas, is a major provider of enterprise-level applications development software, with more than 1,300 employees and a distribution infrastructure in 30 countries in North America, Europe, Asia, Latin America and Africa.
For full-year 1996, Texas Instruments Software had revenues of about $250 million.

Dallas-based Sterling Software is a major provider of software products and services for applications management and systems management, as well as highly technical professional services for the federal government.
For its fiscal year ended Sept. 30, it had revenues of $439.2 million, including $109.8 million from its applications management business.
Sterling Software's stock rose 87.5 cents to $29.25, while Texas Instruments fell 12.5 cents to $81.75 on the New York Stock Exchange in late morning trading.
